Comment: A hacker has obtained direct messages and contact information from TeleMessage, the Israeli software company that offers modified versions of Signal, WhatsApp, Telegram, and other apps to the US government, according to a report from 404Media. Last week, a photo of former National Security Advisor Mike Waltz appeared to show him using a Signal clone offered by the company.  TeleMessage lets users archive their chats in secure messaging apps. However, the hacker reportedly found that TeleMessage’s archived chat logs aren’t end-to-end encrypted, allowing them to access the contents of certain messages, government official contact information, and login credentials for the service’s backend.  Read more: [https://www.theverge.com/news/661173/telemessage-signal-clone-hacked-mike-waltz](https://www.theverge.com/news/661173/telemessage-signal-clone-hacked-mike-waltz)
Author: theverge

Comment: JFC. You're (arguably) the most advanced government on the planet with a bottomless supply of technical specialists. Why would you ever rely on a proprietary (even if it's open source) comms program? It's just reckless.   You design a protocol from the bottom, tie it down, protect it from all sides, and demand that no one use any other system. Period.   It's amazing that heads haven't rolled for this.
Author: barneyrubbble
